name: White Wizard
desc: This job/class is meant to emulate what you might expect a White Mage to be in other Final Fantasy games. Consider Porom or Rosa to be the basis.

name: Pyromancer
desc: A more limited class specializing in fire based abilities, and fire based abilities alone.

name: Elsamancer
desc: A cheap excuse to reference Frozen. I mean, a counter to the Pyromancer that focuses on Ice based magics instead of Fire. Also since logically water can be manipulated there is cause to give this class the Underwater Materia on the argument that they can merely freeze the water around them to avoid drowning.

name: Rogue
desc: the idea is something similar to what you might expect a WoW Rogue to be, with a loose base off of Locke from FF6.

name: Engineer
desc: Consider to be a semi-altered play off of the Pyromancer, and Elsamancer classes. The idea is they still use bolt magic based stuff, but also can do stuff like use a defribulator to revive people, as well as manipulating their speed via ...well zapping the crap out of them with varied voltage.

name: Blue Mage
desc: A character class which primarily focuses on the learning of enemy attacks and delivering them upon the enemy in return. Enemy Lure is available for sanity purposes when attempting to get that one god damn skill.

name: Black Wizard
desc: The counter to the White Wizard class, which instead specializes in black magic styles.

name: Summoner
desc: The Rydia class. This class gets summoning ability, and not a whole lot else. Some summons were left out to ensure this isn't just the "can use all red" class, and to provide some uniqueness to classes they're exclusive to.

name: Paladin
desc: A holy knight. This class has some healing ability, along with primarily battle commands and protection based stuff. This class also is the sole user of KOTR, as it seemed to make sense for a holy knight to be able to summon what is essentially the Knights of the Round Table.

name: Mime
desc: ...It's a mime? Exp Plus also available to a) provide one reason why you MIGHT want one, and be it makes sense in concept because who's learning quicker than a god damn mime? Likewise the plus materia is allowed under the concept that they're trying to emulate the stats of the person they're copying.

name: Magic Knight
desc: Based off of a suggestion by Fu, this class attempts to emulate the class of the same name from FFV.
